>>102718309
>She wasnt telling everything to Max because she was ashamed.

Which would indicate she had much more of an active, personal role in what occurred than she let on. Eg. she purposefully drank more than she said she did and the making out with the guys was just her own lack of self control.

She told Max some pretty scary stuff and asked her to help her out with the situation, so I don't get the feeling she's keeping other not-her-fault details secret ...

>But Nathan is red herring, if he lied in two places would that make it true?

Nathan just seems like a short-tempered rich kid fuck up who thinks he has more power/control than he actually does. I'm just not yet seeing any indication that he has any super important role to play in the game's larger story. He seems somewhat oblivious to the larger issues. Especially at the end of Episode 2, like I said, he happily admits to NOT taking Kate to the hospital without understanding that Max is accusing him with the implication that he was involved in a potential rape. IF he was KNOWINGLY involved in such a situation, why would he be happily admitting to the lead up in front of everybody? It's a she-said/he-said moment, all he has to do is say "uhh, what are you talking about?!" The implication of this is that IF something bad happened to Kate, it was after Nathan was out of the picture.

>And its likely that Jefferson knew what happened.

I don't buy the Jefferson fan-theories yet. Most are based on flimsy SJW-bait evidence at best (omg some of his pics are of girls therefore he is a predator!!). Kate and Mr Jefferson literally only have ~6 lines of dialogue together in the entire game, most of which is fairly generic. Hard to draw much from them. Jefferson seems like a bit of a douchebag (eg. openly letting students - even his favourites, like Max - get bullied in class), but I don't (yet?) buy any of the "he was having an affair with student X,Y,Z" theories.

Dominions is a fantasy turn-based strategy game created by two dudes. One of them is a teacher.

The game combines a simple presentation with an extremely wide array of strategic options, including over 1500 units, 600 spells and 300 magic items. Turns are resolved simultaneously, with players planning battles rather than directly controlling them.

It has simplistic graphics but is easily moddable and extremely deep.

Basically, it's an autist’s wet dream of a strategy game.

threads.com:
>INFORMATION AND GUIDES
http://www.tswdb.com/
http://unfair.co
http://wiki.crygaia.com

>What is this game?
The Secret World is an MMO by Funcom that takes place in the present day, except every legend, myth, and conspiracy theory is true. Yes, even that one. You play as a human given superpowers by Gaia to unfuck the world, and are promptly recruited by one of three secret societies: The Templars, the Illuminati, or the Original Character Do Not Steal society, the Dragon. Unlike most MMOs, this game tries to tell a story and give interesting quests that are more inventive than "kill ten zombies." As such, it's more like an always-online RPG than a proper MMO.

>Is it free to play? If not, why do I give a shit?
You buy the game once and you can play the vanilla story and all the endgame content to your heart's content. The cash shop sells XP boosts, cosmetic items, and DLC. These have all been solo mission packs so far, with issues 8, 9, and 10 unlocking new zones that advance the main story quest. The subscription fee gives you the DLC for free and a stipend of cash shop bucks and stuff like bank, AH, and XP are the same whether you have a subscription or not, so there's no jewery afoot like in, say, Old Republic

>If it were good why haven't I heard about it before?
Because Funcom's marketing department sucks dick.

>There already is a Templar Cabal from last time we had vgs that we could revive. Carpe Virgo Minores, ask Hedraios ingame if interested.

Create 2 text files in your Funcom\The Secret World\scripts\
folder and name those 2 files:
auto_login
auto_teleport

Then REMOVE the file extension! Open them with notepad,notepad++ etc.
Put the following text into both of the files:
delay 5000
/chat join vidya
/chat join Sanctuary

<wpsg> - Gamer District (WotLK) alliance

>Where can I get game clients?
http://pastebin.com/mxjmsr3t

>How do I connect to [server]?
1. Register on a private server that hosts the same game client you have.
2. Copy their realmlist URL. This can usually be found on the main page of the website or on their registration page.
3. Look for a realmlist.wtf file in your WoW folder. This may either be in the root folder, or inside Wow/Data/enUS/
4. Open the realmlist.wtf file in a text editor such as Notepad and paste in the realmlist settings of the server. Make sure it starts with 'set realmlist' followed by the realmlist URL.

>I have set the realmlist correctly but it still connects me to XYZ server/says invalid login info.
You will need a clean wow.exe and dll files if you downloaded your WoW client from XYZ server. Check the clients section above.

>How do I stop my client from auto-updating?
• Start the game with wow.exe - not launcher.exe
• Don't use your email for logging in, use your account name.
• Find the patchlist file in your installation and remove it.

>What is Elsword?
A beat-em-up MMO with an anime/manga-inspired art style. Has emphasis on combos, loops, and resets to prevent knocking down your enemies (or pissing off your teammates in the process if you do KD).

In the PvP aspect, it has random (bullshit) matchmaking in arena (which is ranked, based on letters, not levels), or a sparring mode (which uses a lobby system). Gaps between actual skill level and being carried by BS will vary.

last_replies.com:
>>102673373
>non core missile targetting
while your at it, get the rotation and lock on relative to the center of mass, not the core. Any game that makes an obvious core marker, ie robocuck, becomes pretty simple when you know where to start drilling.

>diminishing returns on weapons / weaker weapons
No, this is a bad idea. Diminishing returns already exists in the game for power, and this doesn't actually help. Remember the russian monolith? At that point, you just encourage some fucker to hack in resources to go insanely big. If the weapons diminished in effectiveness we'd never have managed to kill the damn thing as its shields recharged so quickly.

>Damage cap

as above no. Against a monolith ship you'll make the problem far worse.

>sneaky tactics

This I like.

Essentially certain metas in the game are never really worth it, and should be.More in a follow up post i've ran out of characters.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>102673373
>>102714805

>sneaky tactics

Essentially certain metas in the game are never really worth it, and should be.

The power drain beam for instance sounds like an amazing idea for preventing someone from unloading all they've got on you, but its rediculously weak to the point of worthless.
Similar to the power supply beam.

Theres also radar jamming and cloaking, which I think should work inverse to deminishing returns. Small ships should be able to do these very cheaply, giving them a much better chance vs larger vessels. On the "missiles may miss" idea, again greater chance of dodge success the smaller/lighter a vessel is.

Some easier way to long distance target with beam weapons would be good also, as they've got the range to almost be an alternative to missiles, but its impossible to aim the distance reliably. Maybe just a zoom reticule or key that can be triggered, as the only method i know right now is go into the options and fuck with FOV settings, which isn't particularly viable to do regularly.

Also logic is great to have, BUT nothing interacts BACK to logic. Say I want to check "is a door open" there isn't a way to do this right now. Which makes logic circuits have very low potential for interacting with the world around them. (and can salvage beams please PLEASE link to storage boxes? it's fucking painful to fill your inventory while mining planets with plants)

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
вooбщe skyforge пoжaлyйcтa нacлaждaйтecь

So this game is a bit like Vindictus where players hang around a small town which is just a holding area / quest NPC place before all the content which is mostly instance dungeon-type segments, with some "open" MMO maps thrown into the mix.

The gameplay is quite like Neverwinter with some influence from GW2, Tera, DCUO; "action MMO". The engine seems a bit like the SWTOR engine, however it feels better and doesn't seem plagued with desync - apparently it's their own engine.

The story is like you are a character that freshly discovers they are immortal or wills themselves to be immortal in some battle, and in this world immortals can basically become superhero gods who stand around a lobby all day waiting to go grind missions, which canonically is you helping the mortal plebs. You develop a personal Order, which is your follower NPC / garrison mechanic. Guilds are Pantheons. The game is being localized from Russia and has a lot of placeholder VA right now, its awful and I didn't listen to most of the story, the writing of which seemed shit anyway.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com: The RPG mechanics are honestly pretty cool. There's no traditional character level, instead there's like a simple Sphere Grid and you have to collect different currencies to fill it, ala FFX. There's tanks, damage, and support, but support is not a direct healer. Healing comes from potions (minor, like 3m CD for 30%HP) and globes (main way) dropped like Diablo, and the skill+perk system is quite like Diablo3 - you make a deck of about 10 skills from a pool, and Talents affect Skills directly. You can level all the classes. Armor is all vanity, your equipment is only weapon, off-hand, and 4x rings. each of these 3 areas has a character-wide Upgrade, so your character has a main progression and your class has a slightly separate progression. It's quite grind-happy but in a way I enjoy. It's the kind of game where if you just enjoy the core gameplay, you can always progress your character no matter what, even if you only have time for a quick 10 minute solo game, you can get something done. I think I'm at the point in my life where I can't progress in more 'serious' MMORPGs, personally. This game has broken pretty much everything down into a token/currency system, so if you wanted you could slowly work towards whatever goals you have and eventually get there, rather than commit to a hardcore raid schedule to progress.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
The artstyle is a complete and utter clusterfuck of everything, mythological greece/rome in space. It doesn't really nail a theme well at all, but hey it's a change from orks'n'elves. The character creator is okay, you can adjust things like thigh gap and ass muscles.

Currently there's about a week left of closed beta 3. Russia already has Open beta. EU/NA is just behind because of localization, I heard they will actually catch up for release, it's not going to be perpetually behind the Russian build, but just for now. I just made this thread because there's not really much people playing or talking about it at the moment, but maybe there's some anon here playing. I don't think it deserves major hype, but it has some decent ideas going on, it deserves to at least find it's niche audience and stay alive for now, I think. Was anyone planning on trying the OBT when it comes?

Welcome to /mk8g/ - The youngest Koopaling Edition
Discuss Mario Kart & Mario Spin-off Games!

>Wanna know what /mk8g/ is all about?
Watch this or be a loser:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bNMvL7z2ub0 [Embed]

We got a miiverse page! Post your neat drawings and check out everyone's doodles!
https://miiverse.nintendo.net/titles/14866558073268532636/14866558073646102396

>Game Codes
Main Lobby:
--Mario Kart 8 ALL tracks with all new DLC and 200cc!:
4584-9410-2777 (lobby name is /v/eekend 3.0)

--Frantic Lobby (higher freq of powerful items):
6415-1175-2608

--Mirror Lobby
8033-6549-7779

--Teams Lobby
9950-7090-1141

Other games:
--Mario Kart 7 (ask in thread) : 07-0695-1617-1935
--Mario Golf: World Tour (turns): 58-1023-1832-5422

>How do I play with you guys!?!

--First time racers:
Go to "online - one player", go to "tournaments", go to "search by code", enter our main lobby code "4584-9410-2777", hit "join". If you keep getting put in empty lobbies, the current one is full. Keep hitting "join" periodically and eventually someone will leave & you'll get in

--Returning racers:
Go to "friends" from the online menu & view "recent players" list to find and join someone who is currently racing. You can't join somebody in a new lobby if you haven't first searched for the lobby code

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4ujiTGzARkddUxnTk1LQTNETGs/view

>News
The 2nd DLC, including the 200cc update, is out NOW

>Thread PSA:
Report shitposting!
Regularly announce the number of players in a lobby

>Today's protip
Check your rear view regularly. If somebody behind you has triple reds, you might find it more beneficial to let him pass instead of getting hit!
